name: Put on Your Thinking Cap Online Trivia | Topics for Kids | 10 Questions

questions.text: What does this mean? "I'd give him the shirt off my back."
options: When my shirts get too small for me, I give them to him.
questions.explanation:
I'd do anything for him.

	You probably wouldn't really give someone the shirt off your back, but this is a way of saying that you really care about someone.

questions.text: What does this mean? "If I were in your shoes...."
questions.correct: If I were in your situation....
options: If you and I were the same size....
If  you and I had the same kind of shoes....
If I needed to buy new shoes....
questions.explanation:
If I were in your situation....

	Have you ever heard someone say, "If I were in your shoes, I'd apologize" or "If I were in your shoes, I'd feel very proud of myself"? This expression means "If I were you...." or "If the same thing happened to me...."

questions.text: What does this mean? "We need to tighten our belts."
questions.correct: We need to save money or stop wasting things.
options: If your pants have belt loops, you need to wear a belt.
We need to lose some weight.
questions.explanation:
We need to save money or stop wasting things.

	People use this saying when they realize they are running out of money.

questions.text: What does this mean? "Pull yourself up by your bootstraps."
options: Pretend you are happy even if you aren't.
Help others if they need help.
Get help if you need it.
questions.explanation:
Do something to help yourself.

	This is a way of saying: "If you have a problem, try to figure out solutions yourself."

questions.text: What does this mean? "Keep your shirt on!"
questions.explanation:
Be patient!.

	Another expression that means the same thing is, "Hold your horses!"

questions.text: What does this mean? "I take off my hat to you."
options: I don't understand what you said.
questions.explanation:
I admire you.

	When people used to wear hats more often, they'd take them off to politely say hello or show respect to others.

questions.text: What does this mean? "She has something up her sleeve."
questions.explanation:
She has a secret plan.

	Maybe this saying is based on the way magicians hide objects inside their sleeves.

questions.text: What does this mean? "He's gotten too big for his britches."
options: He's smarter than others in his age group.
questions.explanation:
He's conceited or stuck up.

	This is a way of saying, "He's thinks he's better than other people." Britches are pants, in case you didn't know.

questions.text: What does this mean? "Don't get hot under the collar."
options: Don't wear clothes that are too small for you.
questions.explanation:
Don't get mad.

	When people get mad they sometimes get hot. Have you ever noticed that?

questions.text: What does this mean? "I wear many hats."
options: My moods changes all the time.
questions.explanation:
I have many different jobs.

	If someone is a mom, a wife, a sister, a daughter, a school teacher, a club president, and a pet owner, she wears many different hats.
